author: aadamchik
msg: 1. Migrating from JDOM to JAXP for all XML features (btw JAXP also has pretty-print functionality)

2. Refactoring XMLEncoder to (a) better maintain tree state during encoding and (b) provide more consistent an easy to use API for all possible combionations of encoded object types and encoding strategies
it is still pretty dirty under the hood, so more refactoring is likely
